original: Lindqvist, Axel Martin, professor, Göteborg, f. 15/11/82 i Malmö av byggmäst. Anders L. o. Maria Landgren. G. 16 m. Elisabeth Friman. Barn: Karin f. 18, fil. mag., Britta 26, elev v. Röda korset, Sthlm. — Stud:-ex. 01, fil. kand. i Lund 04, fil. lic. 09, fil. dr 12, stud. v. univ. i Greifswald 04 o. i Leipzig: 08-09. Föret, ett fiert. utr. studires. Doc. i nord. språk v. Lunds univ. 12-17, i tyska språket 17-20, ’lektor v. Hälsingborgs h, a. L 18, v. Södermalms lärov. i Sthlm 27, doc. i tyska språket v. Sthlms högsk. 28-35, prof. i dito v. Gbgs högsk. sed. 35, högsk. prorektor 46. Lär. v. priv. h. lär:nesem. i Lund 09-16, v. Lunds fullst. lärov. f. fl., gymn., 16-19, v. KHS 30-35. Censor v. stud:ex. sed. 32, tf. und:visn:råd vissa period. 30, 31, 32 o. 34, uppf. på försl. t. prof. i tyska språket v. univ. i Köpenhamn 25. Ordf. i Lunds stud:kår 10 o. 11, i Lektorernas för en. 31-36 o. dess hediled. 37, ordf. i ^styr. f. Mathiilda Haifls sk. 35-39, insp. f. Vasa komm. flicksk. sed. 45, led. av Deutsche Akad. (wissensch. Aht.) 33, led. av ndn f. sv. språkvård 45, LVVS 37. Skr.: Stud. över sv. verbaladjektiv (09), Gramma-tiskt o. psykol. subjekt i svenskan (12), Bernhardus Ancumanus, Rosari-um (26), Johann Grob, Epigramme (29), Studien über Wortwahl und Wortbedeutung im Althochdeutschen (35), Om ord o. ungdom (26), I språkets spegel (42), Mannen, kvinnan o. ’Språket (44) jämte andra textpubl. o. avh. i nord. o. tysk filoh, läroböcker, upps. i språkl., pedagog, o. andra kulturfrågor i tidskr. o. tidn. RNO.
translated: Lindqvist, Axel Martin, professor, Gothenburg, b. 15/11/82 in Malmö to builder Anders L. and Maria Landgren. Married since 1916 to Elisabeth Friman. Children: Karin, b. 1918, graduated with a master's degree, Britta, b. 1926, student at the Red Cross in Stockholm. Completed studies: High school diploma in 1901, bachelor's degree in Lund in 1904, licensed in philosophy in 1909, PhD in philosophy in 1912. Studied at the University of Greifswald in 1904 and in Leipzig in 1908-1909. Started a career with frequent study trips. Became a docent in Nordic languages at Lund University from 1912-1917, then in German language from 1917-1920. Lecturer at the Hälsingborg high school and the Södermalm secondary school in Stockholm. Became a docent in German language at Stockholm University from 1928-1935, then a professor at Gothenburg University since 1935, and vice-rector of the university in 1946. Taught at private teacher's training seminary in Lund from 1909-1916, then at various schools and gymnasiums in Lund from 1916-1919 and from 1930-1935. Served as an examiner for high school diplomas since 1932, acting educational advisor during certain periods in 1930, 1931, 1932, and 1934. Proposed for a professorship in German language at the University of Copenhagen in 1925. Served as chairman of the Lund student union in 1910 and 1911, as well as the Teachers' Association from 1931-1936 and honorary member from 1937. Also served as chairman of the Mathilda Haifl's school board from 1935-1939 and inspector for the Vasa municipal girls' school since 1945. A member of the Deutsche Akademie (Wissenschaftliche Abhandlungen) since 1933 and the Swedish Language Society since 1945. Published works include: "Studies on Swedish Verbal Adjectives" (1909), "Grammatical and Psychological Subject in Swedish" (1912), "Bernhardus Ancumanus, Rosarium" (1926), "Johann Grob, Epigrams" (1929), "Studies on Word Choice and Word Meaning in Old High German" (1935), "On Words and Youth" (1926), "In the Mirror of Language" (1942), "Man, Woman, and Language" (1944), along with other text publications and essays in Nordic and German philology, textbooks, and articles on language, pedagogy, and other cultural issues in journals and newspapers. Member of the Royal Science Society (Kungliga Vitterhetsakademien) since 1937.

author.name: Grammatical and Psychological Subject in Swedish
Studies on Word Choice and Word Meaning in Old High German
